intro: [WRONG START] Uncia uncinata var. laxior, commonly known as the slender hookweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and streambanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, and it produces small, clustered flower heads. The variety laxior is distinguished by its more loosely arranged inflorescences compared to the typical form.
